page.title: 08Palmer's Farm 2
page.content: (continued from page 7) No staff are now maintained and the farm cottages have been sold to private dwellers, but contract labour and machinery are employed when necessary,e.g.in Spring and Autumn.The land itself has seen little change in Mr. McCheyne's life time.As a boy, he walked down the same road to St.Mary's school, only now a bridge over the bypass spans the original valley. There are fewer houses along the road,as unnecessary cottages for farm labourers have been demolished.Half a dozen hedges have been removed from the farmland but the boundary hedge between the brothers' farms has been retained, since this has been dated back to the 13th century. Mr. McCheyne welcomes the changes.He says the pace of life is easier now and the standard of living better.
